Info: First Time I'd heard anything other than Good Life (from Scrubs) Absolutely amazing, it flew by, could have listened to it all night
Absolutely Brilliant. It was in Hall 2 which is perfect for a musician like David, felt more like you were in a private gig.

Absolutely amazing gig, words can't describe but I'll try.
He played the Kilty Stone which is my favourite song of all time.
There was a considerate break half way through to get drinks (& a smoke :|), don't think that happens much.
He got more drunk as the night went on but the playing didn't suffer.
A great mix of old and new songs with great banter with the audience.
The string replacement happened again which never gets old.
One thing I love about Live gigs is that fact that not everything is perfect, words were forgotten, notes were missed but if you want it exactly the same just listen to the album.
I think he needs to release more Live albums as this is where he shines, so many songs aren't done justice on the studio releases ...

Brilliant as always!
Shame he was only on for about 40 minutes.
He did Song For The Road, gotta mention the Angel and tipping your har :)
He supported Teddy Thompson who wasn't my taste in music.
Pre gig to test for the upcoming tour, absolutely hilarious!

Brilliant.
Absolutely perfected the art.
Can't wait for the new album

A friend is a member of VOTT, awesome night. Great music, sang and danced along.

Richard John Thompson was support too. (RJ as he goes by now)

Northern Rock Foundation Hall.

Awesome gig as always, no support so 2 50min sets from the main man! Couldn't ask for more.
Looping was superb.
It was The Arrangement EP Tour, I love The Snake song especially.

First time ever I was a little disappointed.
The setup wasn't as great as usual, a few instruments were off and the harmonica broke.

Still great to see him and got a tea towel so all is good.
